newsitem.title: JAPAN: Dlr gains strength vs yen but top-heavy in Tokyo.
newsitem.headline: Dlr gains strength vs yen but top-heavy in Tokyo.

text.p: 0500 GMT-- *Dollar edged up against yen in afternoon Tokyo partly on short-covering by interbank dealers and overseas operators, but topside remained heavy after upside trial above 127.10 yen ended in failure in morning.
*A trust bank dealer said some interbank dealers have dollar long positions after earlier rally in morning, which are likely to keep dollar gains limited.
*Options-linked stop-loss buying expected to emerge near 127.30 yen, but sales to avoid hitting options positions weighing on dollar.
*"Dealers find it difficult to buy aggressively after the dollar tested its upside in the morning," said another trust bank dealer.
*He added that although exporters sold some dollars near 127 yen earlier in morning, they were not aggressive sellers overall since Japan's "Golden Week" holiday started this week.
*The first trust bank dealer said institutional investors have not been major market players.
0300 GMT --- *Dollar took breather after setting a three-year high of 1.7395 marks and coming close to a 56-month high against the yen by midday Tokyo.
*Dollar surged against mark and yen as market focused on failure of Group of Seven (G7) meeting on Sunday to make specific reference to "a weak yen" as shared concern.
*G7 communique stressed need to avoid currency rates that spur trade imbalances, which indirectly referred to yen and Japan's rising trade surplus, traders said.
*But market perception that European nations do not seem worried about the dollar's recent rise made traders cover short dollar positions built previously.
